str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To arrive at, reach, come to. From apo and the base of hikanos; to go forth.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Obedience, submissiveness, compliance. From hupakouo; attentive hearkening, i.e. compliance or submission.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Wise, learned, cultivated, skilled, clever. Akin to saphes; wise.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary word; 'good'.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
(lit: unmixed) simple, unsophisticated, sincere, blameless. Unmixed, i.e. innocent.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
